intro: Pouteria densinervia, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces a unique fruit known as a "samaúma," which contains the edible seeds used to make Brazil nuts. The bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. It plays a vital role in the ecosystem and is an important species for both wildlife and human communities.
